robeger wrote:

>
> I know you can put a max number of documents for a crawl, but can you
> set a max number of documents per site?

Take a look at the DomainSensitiveFrontier: 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html.  
Here is from its description:

41 <http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html#41>  / * Behaves like {@link HostQueuesFrontier} (i.e., a basic mostly breadth-first frontier),/
42 <http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html#42>  / * but with the addition that you can override the number of documents to/
43 <http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html#43>  / * download for a specific host or domain.  Useful for case of frequent/
44 <http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/DomainSensitiveFrontier.html#44>  / * revisits of a site of frequent changes.
